article.headline: Quinnipiac 73, Robert Morris 69
article.story: HAMDEN, Conn. -- James Johnson scored 28 points and Ousmane Drame had a double-double to lead Quinnipiac to a 73-69 win over Robert Morris on Saturday in the regular-season finale for both teams. Drame finished with 12 points and 11 rebounds -- five offensive -- for the Bobcats (17-12, 10-8 Northeast Conference), who have two straight games. Garvey Young had 11 points. Quinnipiac trailed 60-59 with 2:29 left in the second half when Velton Jones knocked down two free throws. But James, who went 4 of 8 from beyond the arc, put the Bobcats ahead by two points and for good on a 3-pointer. Jones scored 29 points on 9 of 17 shooting but fouled out for the Colonials (22-9, 13-5), who had their six-game winning streak snapped. Russell Johnson scored 15 points and grabbed seven rebounds in the loss. Quinnipiac outrebounded Robert Morris 39-28.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
